home.title: Exploring Differential Geometry in 3D
home.intro: Welcome to the interactive simulator of Differential Geometry, where mathematical concepts take shape, depth, and motion in three-dimensional space.
home.description1: This virtual environment was designed to offer a new perspective on curves and surfaces. Here, complex geometric structures—often confined to paper or abstract thought—become dynamic and visual objects ready for exploration.
home.description2: Our goal is to bridge theory and interactive visualization. Parametric curves, smooth surfaces, curvature, torsion, and other geometric properties are within your reach, presented through a clean and distraction-free interface.
home.quote: “Mathematics is the art of naming and shaping the invisible structures that shape the world.”

learnBasics.title: Introduction to Differential Geometry
learnBasics.intro: Differential Geometry explores the properties of curves and surfaces using calculus and linear algebra to describe the geometry of space.
learnBasics.quote: “Geometry reveals the shape of the universe.”

topic1.title: Curves and Surfaces
topic1.desc: Understand how curves and surfaces are mathematically defined and how they can be represented in 3D simulations.

topic2.title: Regular Curves
topic2.desc: Learn what characterizes a differentiable curve as regular, based on the non-vanishing of the derivative of the position vector.

topic3.title: Arc Length
topic3.desc: Understand how to calculate the length of a curve from a differentiable parameterization using definite integrals.

topic4.title: Curvature
topic4.desc: The curvature of a parameterized curve measures how much the curve deviates from a straight line at a point, defined as the norm of the derivative of the unit tangent vector with respect to the arc length.

topic5.title: Torsion
topic5.desc: The torsion of a curve measures the variation of the unit normal vector along the curve, essential for understanding three-dimensional geometry.

topic6.title: Frenet Frame
topic6.desc: The Frenet frame is a local coordinate system formed by the tangent, normal, and binormal vectors of a regular curve, describing the curve's orientation in three-dimensional space.

learnBasics.theory: Differential geometry integrates calculus into the study of shapes to analyze curvature, torsion, and surface structures. It provides the mathematical language to describe the natural world, from simple planes to complex curved manifolds.
learnBasics.theory2: Understanding these principles allows for accurate simulation of real surfaces, which is essential in geospatial analysis, physical simulations, and 3D graphics.

about.title: About the Simulator
about.intro: This simulator was created to provide an interactive experience for studying Differential Geometry.
about.description: Its goal is to offer an educational tool that makes learning curves and surfaces more accessible, visual, and intuitive. Through 3D exploration, users can dynamically observe geometric properties.
about.tech: The project combines modern technologies such as React, Three.js, and TailwindCSS, integrating computational visualization with advanced mathematics in a minimalist interface.
